intro: Racosperma spanium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its yellow flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Racosperma spanium is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient component of native Australian flora.
